intro: Vulneraria caesalpini, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture. Vulneraria caesalpini is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in full sun. It is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
